description: Gets a list of limits defined in the specified farm.

parameters.name: farmId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the farm that contains the limits.

nested_items.name: limits
nested_items.description: A list of limits that the farm contains.

nested_items.name: displayName
nested_items.description: The name of the limit used in lists to identify the limit.

nested_items.name: amountRequirementName
nested_items.description: The value that you specify as the name in the amounts field of the hostRequirements in a step of a job template to declare the limit requirement.

nested_items.name: maxCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of resources constrained by this limit. When all of the resources are in use, steps that require the limit won't be scheduled until the resource is available.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp of the date and time that the limit was created.

nested_items.name: createdBy
nested_items.description: The user identifier of the person that created the limit.

nested_items.name: updatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp of the date and time that the limit was last updated.

nested_items.name: updatedBy
nested_items.description: The user identifier of the person that last updated the limit.

nested_items.name: farmId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the farm that contains the limit.

nested_items.name: limitId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the limit.

nested_items.name: currentCount
nested_items.description: The number of resources from the limit that are being used by jobs. The result is delayed and may not be the count at the time that you called the operation.

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If Deadline Cloud returns nextToken, then there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. To retrieve the next page, call the operation again using the returned token. Keep all other arguments unchanged. If no results remain, then nextToken is set to null. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. If you provide a token that isn't valid, then you receive an HTTP 400 ValidationException error.
